sentence.Network_en: You are a poltroon to abuse your strength.
sentence.Network_cn: 你是一个滥用武力的懦夫。

sentence.Network_en: No one likes to be regarded as a poltroon.
sentence.Network_cn: 没有人愿意被看作懦夫.

sentence.Network_en: " Coward! Poltroon !'squeaked Reepicheep. " Give me my sword and free my paws if you dare. "
sentence.Network_cn: “ 懦夫! 胆小鬼! ”雷佩契普尖声叫喊着, “ 有胆量就把剑还给我,把我的爪子放开! ”

PerfectNetExp.abs: melancholy adj. 忧郁的poltroon n. 懦夫dastard 懦夫
pockmark 麻子poltroon 胆小鬼popinjay 花花公子

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: from French poltron, from Italian poltrone, perhaps from poltro 'sluggard'

stems_affixes.word_buile: buff拉丁文癞蛤蟆之意+oon人或物→n.丑角,缺乏教养之人
spit吐痰+oon人或物→spittoon→用来吐痰之物

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有钱有势的企业家,大亨
stems_affixes.word_buile: tyc+oon人或物→来自日本话:太君之意
harp钩子,作为单词有"竖琴"之意+oon人或物→n.[捕鲸的]鱼叉

sentences.en: Every moment of the fashion industry’s misery is richly deserved by the designers and magazine poltroons who perpetuate this absurd creation.
sentences.cn: 时装工业每一个痛苦的时刻都是完全应该被时装设计师们…和那些使这种荒诞创造永久化的杂志懦夫领受。
